channel.title: Hybrid Mapping Command + Movement

item.title: Hybrid Mapping Command + Movement
item.dc:creator: @ZhaR ZhaR
item.description:
@ZhaR wrote:

My code was sucessfull. I said i was not the maker of the code. What i did was, before when you use the code it would make them not move at all. u had all 1 1 1 1 1 1 1… what i did was make them move +3 +3 -3 -3 of the coordinants that you put them on. Its nothing complicated, really.[br][size=1]Posted at: April 07, 2006, 09:39:19 am[/size][hr]the piece of code “// =SUM(” + absY + "+3) " Sum is acutally used in EXCEL to add. Say, you could use =SUM(3+5) it would come up 8. What I did was make it ADD 3 to absY and absX, and subtract. One thing I dont get is why dont they appear there right away when i do this. It updates on my autospawn, but they dont appear right away.

Read full topic

item.title: Hybrid Mapping Command + Movement
item.dc:creator: @ZhaR ZhaR
item.description:
@ZhaR wrote:

Here is what i got so far. THIS IS NOT A WORKING ONE.

public void map(String s)
{

    File f = new File("./autospawn.cfg");

    try{
        BufferedReader buff = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(f));
        PrintWriter pw = new PrintWriter(new FileWriter(f, true));
        String line = buff.readLine();
        while(line != null){
            line = buff.readLine();

        }
        if(line == null){
            pw.println("spawn = " + s + "	" + absX + "	" + absY + "	0	=SUM(" + absX + "+3)	=SUM(" + absY + "+3)	=SUM(" + absX + "-3)	=SUM(" + absX + "-3)	1");
            pw.flush();
        }
        buff.close();
        pw.close();
    }
    catch(Exception e){}

}

//----------------------------------------------------------------------------

How do i make it so in excel it does the //=SUM(" + absY + "+3) and acutally does ADD??? Or what other command can i use?

Read full topic
